markdownRemark.html:
I came upon this issue when I wanted to load a p5 sketch into this website as a background on the Homepage. Usually, what I'd do is add the the necessary files as : 

<head>
    <script 
        language="javascript" 
        type="text/javascript" 
        src="source/to/file.js" />
</head>

But, I couldn't do it in React. React doesn't use our standard HTML format. It uses "components" which export the HTML data automatically(I don't know how this works yet). So I did some searching and found this solution.

1. Create a new component

I created a new component named "AddExternalJS.js"
In this component, generate a a basic react code as follows :

import React from "react"
import { Helmet } from "react-helmet"

export default () => (
<Helmet>
    <title>Hello</title>
    <script
    language="javascript"
    type="text/javascript"
    src={`../../myscripts/myscript.js`}
    />
</Helmet>
)

2. Add component export to you index page component if required
Now, my project housed another component "index.js" which just exported all other components. 

export { default as AddExternalJS } from "./AddExternalJS"

3. Import component to index page Doing step 2 makes it easier to import the component from our pages, like : 

import { AddExternalJS } from "../components"

4. Call component as normal HTML tag
Now, finally, we can use our component like any other react component

<AddExternalJS />

frontmatter.title: Adding External JS to your React WebApp
frontmatter.author: Sourav Kulkarni
